vista.graph
Interface TickGenerator

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleTickGenerator, TimeTickGenerator
public interface TickGenerator

Generates information for tick placement and their associated labels using a range of given maximum and minimum.

Version:
$Id: TickGenerator.java,v 1.1 2003/10/02 20:49:10 redwood Exp $
Author:
Nicky Sandhu

Method Summary
 void generate(double minimum, double maximum)
          Generates ticks and labels given the minimum and maximum of the data range.
 java.text.Format getFormatter()
          gets the format object used in generating the labels
 java.lang.String[] getLabels()
          Returns the array of labels for major ticks.
 TickData[] getTickData()
          Returns an array of TickData.
 void useDataMinMax(boolean useIt)
          a suggestion to the tick generator to use the beginning and ending data points when generating labels.
 

Method Detail

generate

void generate(double minimum,
              double maximum)
Generates ticks and labels given the minimum and maximum of the data range.

Parameters:
minimum - The minimum value of the data range
maximum - The maximum value of the data range

getTickData

TickData[] getTickData()
Returns an array of TickData. Be sure to call generate to initialize the generator before calling this function

Returns:
array of TickData
See Also:
TickData, generate(double, double)

getLabels

java.lang.String[] getLabels()
Returns the array of labels for major ticks. Be sure to call generate to initialize the generator before calling this function

Returns:
array of strings
See Also:
generate(double, double)

getFormatter

java.text.Format getFormatter()
gets the format object used in generating the labels

useDataMinMax

void useDataMinMax(boolean useIt)
a suggestion to the tick generator to use the beginning and ending data points when generating labels.
